content: @Josh Triplett FYI opened up https://github.com/rust-lang/cargo/pull/8500
I opened up the two issues I proposed in the meeting, and linked them from that PR.
@XAMPPRocky When you run the relnotes tool, does that provide enough information that you can easily see if someone posted suggested text for the release notes in an issue?
See https://github.com/rust-lang/cargo/pull/8500 , which is tagged relnotes; I posted a comment in the thread that provides suggested text (in markdown format) for the release notes.
I read the issues so if you mention it or call it out in the top post I’ll see it.
It isn't in the top post, it's a couple of comments down.
Yeah in the thread is also generally fine. Though I prefer in the top post when there’s a lot of activity as it can be hard to find and determine the context.
It's too bad it isn't possible to label a specific comment.
@Alex Crichton Would you mind editing a link to https://github.com/rust-lang/cargo/pull/8500#issuecomment-660311898 into your top post, referencing it as having relnotes text in it?
I have edit permission on his comment, I don't entirely know why.
@Eh2406 I believe everyone with write access is able to edit the top comment.
